greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let x(n) denote the number of 4's among the n first elements of the continued fraction for sum k>=0 1/2^(2^k) (A007400), y(n) the number of 6's and z(n) the number of 2's. Then a(n)=x(n)-y(n)-z(n)-1.
comment: The positive sequence has a(n) = mod(A000120(A047849(n)),2) = mod(A000120(A078008(2n)),2) - _Paul Barry_, Jan 13 2005
Cosh(1) in 'reflected factorial' base is 1.10101010101010101010101010101010101010101010... - see A091337 for Sinh(1) (from _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 04 2005)
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
formula: It seems that a(2k+1) = 0 for k>=1.

The positive sequence (assuming the pattern continues) has g.f. (1+x-x^2)/((1-x)(1-x^2)), with a(n)=(1-(1)^n)/2+0^n = mod((1+A001045(n+1))/2, 2) = mod(A005578, 2). The partial sums are A008619(n+1). - _Paul Barry_, Apr 28 2004
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 18 2002
